AttackerCapabilities: Ability to perform path traversal attacks

Steps.Description: Exploit the logic error in user authentication to gain access to admin functions.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker is performing this action to bypass the authentication and gain access to admin functions.
StepDetails.Action: Craft a request with the 'c' parameter set to 'i' (signin) and provide a valid username and password.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully signs in as a user.

Steps.Description: Exploit the logic error in user authentication to perform admin commands.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker is performing this action to execute admin commands without proper authorization.
StepDetails.Action: Craft a request with the 'c2' parameter set to one of the admin commands ('gu', 'gd', 'gp', 'cf')
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully executes the chosen admin command.

Steps.Description: Perform path traversal to access sensitive files.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker is performing this action to access the 'user.db' and 'passcode.db' files.
StepDetails.Action: Craft a request with the 'c2' parameter set to 'gd' (export_db) and provide the 'db' parameter as '../lib/db/user.db' or '../lib/db/passcode.db'
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully retrieves the contents of the chosen file.
